Reviews.Title: “An average hotel, below the typical La Quinta standard”
Reviews.Author: Travel_and_Learn99
Reviews.Content: We were here for 1 night, and we got a decent price thanks to "name your own price" thru a bidding website. The staff were less than friendly. The room was OK but not the typical La Quinta standard (we had stayed at least half a dozen LQs before), a bit rundown. The breakfast room is very small and can be crowded when a few more people showed up at the same time. Would I stay here again? Maybe, if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: Comfortable and clean room - excellent staff - went above and beyond to make our stay pleasant. Accommodated my request for no chemical cleaners.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGrammy2011
Reviews.Content: We had tried our usual hotel chains but could not find a room due to the Illinois State Wrestling Tournaments...so we found out later. We looked around and The La Quinta Inn had rooms available. Reviews were mixed but not bad so we went for it. We were pleasantly surprised as it was clean, pretty comfy and the breakfast was ok, albeit a little crowded but that is understandable with all the young boys in town. There is no elevator and our room was on the second floor. Me, with a bad knee, was not too happy about that but we managed. All in all, ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great for visiting U of I”
Reviews.Author: tac_123
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy, hotel staff friendly, room was clean, and breakfast was just fine for a no frills hotel. Mattress was a little too soft. Great location and good value for a college visit, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Get out!”
Reviews.Author: IowaTraveler20
Reviews.Content: Arrived late for business. First room I was sent to was being painted with materials and drop clothes in the room. Second room key didn't work. After my 3rd trip back to the desk after midnight I got into my room. It was a decent 2 star not 3. I had an afternoon meeting so I used the morning to work. Just before 11 ( 12 checkout time ) I heard the cleaning gal outside my room loudly declare "people need to get the F.. Out" I did and that will be my last la quinta stay!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: xtagus
Reviews.Content: My folks and I drove from Wisconsin to the Illini/Badger football game and had booked this hotel a couple of months ago. It was clean and roomy. The only complaints I have are that the walls are very thin. We learned this when drunk Badger fans couldn't find their key at 2am. I travel with ear plugs so it wasn't too bad for me. The only other thing I didn't like were the towels. They reminded me of gym towels at the club, very thin and small. I used two or three at a time. Other than that, it was great, we paid $140 a night. My folks got a senior discount at $127. I do think they take pets, cuz I heard a dog park the following morning. Perhaps there are certain rooms for pet owners, cuz our room didn't smell or look like critters had been in there. They also had Samsung 36 inch flat screen tv's too, very nice. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “friendly service. good location”
Reviews.Author: thomasannen
Reviews.Content: check in was happy and easy. room was clean. tv was updated and was nice to watch hd. room had different smell, thought it migh be cleaner, but opened window and filled with fresh air. was fine after that. plenty of places to eat withing walking distance, breakfast was continental plus style. room was clean and quiet. good to better value for price. wasy to highway.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rwdawtravel
Reviews.Content: Was in town for a wedding and the host hotel was $200+ per night so we found an inexpensive alternative. The service was great we were part of 5 rooms and they did a great job positioning us near each other, or not when we wanted. The rooms were nice and roomy, the interior halls were nice and the hotel was well secured. The pool was nice as well. The breakfast was nice with hard boiled eggs, waffles and the usual continental items.

Reviews.Title: “Tolerable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lanny77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights in mid-June. The room was clean however outdated. The bathroom fixtures could really use some updating as they appeared kind of run down. The linens were clean. The mattress felt old and was kind of uncomfortable. The room did come with a mini fridge which was nice for us. I am pretty picky when it comes to cleanliness with hotels and like I mentioned in the title, it was tolerable. Clean but outdated. On a side note, the hotel was pretty busy the three nights we stayed here. Our third and final night was the only time we had issues with loud guests in the hallway. On this night there were a bunch of families staying in the hotel. At first it was the children running and screaming in the hallway. Then after the kids were put to bed the parents decided to gather in the hallway and talk. A quick call down to the front desk took care of the problem.

Reviews.Title: “My worst experience in a hotel yet!”
Reviews.Author: LindaZukowski
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay for 3 nights for my son's wedding. We barely stayed for an hour it was so bad! The whole place stunk like cigarette smoke, even the lobby! Then there was the supposed 'low flow' toilet they said they just changed over to which would not even flush toilet paper let alone anything else (though the immediately sent a plunger when I complained, but no one to fix it). But the last straw was when we found they charged the wrong credit card (the one attached to our bank account) for the room instead of putting it on the actual charge card we presented at check in! We repacked what we had unpacked and immediately found a different hotel. It took over a week for the to refund the account the improperly charged! I will never book a room with any La Quinta after this horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth32655
Reviews.Content: This looks like a newer La Quinta. The only one better I have stayed at is in Carter Lake, Iowa. The Champaign La Quinta is in the top two. Mostly quiet (except for a few children, but it was 4th of July weekend) very clean. The person at the front desk was the friendliest I have encountered, and very dog friendly as well. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, very clean, could use some updating”
Reviews.Author: CFire2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the University of Illinois' graduation weekend. As expected, the rate was very high, but I assume it is much lower throughout the year. The room was very clean, though was quite old and could use some updating. It was also very large. Service was very good and the free breakfast was quite nice. The free internet was much faster than that of other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for an overnight stop with dogs”
Reviews.Author: SixthSister
Reviews.Content: This hotel and most LaQuintas are below my normal standards but when on the road with beagles I have found the chain to be consistently decent. The champaign location was in an area with several other hotels and restaurant. We (actually the beagles) were warmly welcomed at reception. The room was basic but clean and appeared to he recently updated. We were happy to find a microwave and fridge. We spent a quiet night and skipped breakfast. Slightly overpriced at $69 for an older hotel but otherwise no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: shiny62
Reviews.Content: The room was nice. Pretty much what is expected of a La Quinta. The only negative is that the hallways VERY strongly smelled of smoke. Quiet. Convenient. Close to many restauarants and a mall.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Disgusted”
Reviews.Author: gossipghoulv
Reviews.Content: Gave us a smoking room when we were promised a non-smoking room on phone. Thought it would be OK but the room reeked. The pool was disgusting; hadn't been cleaned and swarming with large horseflies. It took 2 letters and 6 months to get any compensation for our horrible stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robo34
Reviews.Content: Hotel seemed clean enough. Room was ok. Maybe an older hotel. They had breakfast but it was sub par compared to other hotels continental breakfast. I would stay here again if I had a good price. It's an average hotel that is fine if you're not paying a lot.

Reviews.Title: “LaQuinta stay”
Reviews.Author: jkdaves
Reviews.Content: Good for travellers with pets. Room was large and by the pool. Lots of area to walk dogs and across from a mall.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: LoganSquareNeighbor
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel two times and both times that rates were among the least expensive in the Champaign/Urbana area. Highly recommend the hotel for families with young children as long as it is warm enough to use the outdoor pool! Rooms are very clean and the pool is nice with plenty of towels provided. Free breakfast was varied and generous.

Reviews.Title: “Does not meet La Quinta Standards”
Reviews.Author: txcouple70
Reviews.Content: I booked a 4 night stay online. I will never do this for La Quinta again. We were visiting family in Champaign and Ogden, IL. Once we got into Champaign, we were greeted nicely and expressed check-in was great. Once we entered the hall to our room we new we were in for a surprise. The smell was enough to tell us we were not going to stay. Opened the door to the room and I went straight to the bed. Pulled down the covers of the nicely made bed and pushed down on the mattress. My hand sunk 3 1/2 " down the impression on the that side of the bed. The impression on the bed mattress looked like a one ton egg had rested there for a year. Mattresses need to be replaced after such continuous use. I called the front desk and told the attendant she would need to cancel our 4 day reservation because of the bed and their hotel did not meet the La Quinta standards of service. Lesson Learned. Don't book anything under a 4 star hotel online because you do not know what you are getting. Thank Goodness the Courtyard Marriott down the street accomodated us for 4 nights stay with no reservation or notice. Hats off to Courtyard Marriott. From Georgetown, Texas, long-time (16 yrs.)user of La Quinta.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost!”
Reviews.Author: Madwolf
Reviews.Content: Stayed June 10th. Hotel needs repairs and an upgrade. Room smelled of dirty sox. Bathroom fans was so noisy you couldn't hear. Carpets... well let say you don't want to take you socks off. I'd rather walk barefoot through an Illinois corn field! Internet service pittyful! The only place I could access was in the hotel lobby! Last point in must have been dog night. I counted 5 rooms on my floor which had dogs in the room... It explains the carpet....

Reviews.Title: “A true 2.5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel2beaches
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times as I have a family member I visit in Champaign every few months. The hotel is located close to unlimited retail stores and restaurants. There is easy access to interstate 74. The hotel entrance does -not- have automatic entrance doors or an elevator which is a mental note I always make as my 70 year old mother would require those amenities. The staff is pleasant. There is coffee, hot water for tea and hot chocolate, fruit and a local news paper in the lobby. Usually my rooms have been on the first floor close to the lobby however this visit I was booked as far away from the lobby as you can get and on the 2nd floor. The is a security key entrance that worked well. However, considering it is January and there's snow, rolling my luggage from the car to the hotel door, pausing in the blowing snow to use my key for entrance and up a flight of stairs with large piece of luggage to my room, would have been difficult with children or for an older person. The room is rather large, has 2 double beds, a table area for eating or computer work, a closet and a tub/toilet separated from the bathroom sink. There are blackout drapes. A disappointment was the poor TV station selection. ABC,NBC and CBS are -not- selections available. I would have paid to have that option but it wasn't available. Most of the stations were sports. If you want a wake up call you have to arrange it with the front desk. I prefer the auto option. Wireless internet is free. It's a good hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Dog Friendly”
Reviews.Author: JimM5
Reviews.Content: Allowed us to stay with our multiple dogs. Accommodated us even though the place was booked. Very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel but cute room.”
Reviews.Author: ml07oz
Reviews.Content: We were in the process of moving from Austin, TX to Chicago, IL and we had 2 huge moving trucks, 2 dogs and a cat. We had to park in a vacant lot next to the hotel instead of the hotel lot itself. We also very quickly discovered the hotel had no elevators. With our room upstairs, and 2 dogs, 1 cat and 6 bags plus a cooler we also discovered very quickly this hotel had no luggage dollies. The key to our room didn't work either, i'm thinking the day shift didn't put the right key with the right room and the overnight clerk must've not done a key audit to make sure all the keys matched... Once we got into the room and were situated, the stay was fine. It is an older hotel that uses the punch card keys and make sure you don't forget breakfast is over at 9am on weekdays. 9:15 Is was too late for them to let us have a go at the breakfast bar...

Reviews.Title: “GROSS!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel0783
Reviews.Content: This is probably the nastiest hotel in which I've ever had to stay. It makes the Red Roof Inn seem like luxury accommodations. The hallways smelled of poop, mold and cigarette smoke. Not to mention children and their drunk parents running up and down the hallways at all hours of the night. Our room, which was supposed to be one of the nicest rooms in the hotel, had cobwebs in the bathroom and a poop stain in the toilet. It's quite evident from ground-in dirt stains on the bathroom floor that the floors aren't mopped often. I would advise bringing flip flops to wear, even in the shower, if you choose to stay here. For the price, I would recommend you go to one of the other hotels off I-74 in Champaign.

Reviews.Title: “err--nothing to write home about.”
Reviews.Author: develbow
Reviews.Content: I'l start off with the positives--the hotel has a wonderful location, it was quiet, and the hallways had a wonderful apple smell. Other than that, I really felt I could have done better for the money. Our room was fairly clean, but the beds were worn and uncomfortable--you seldom see double beds in hotel rooms these days but be prepared for them here. They made a big deal about the fact that there were mini-fridges in the rooms, but that means you don't have a recliner, and the fridge just sits on the floor rather than on a table, making it difficult to use.There was a hairdryer in the room, but it was broken, and the alarm clock was not only set about two hours ahead of the actual time, but the alarm was also going off loudly when we returned to our room after dinner. A free breakfast is always nice, but the area in which it was offered was so small that you really couldn't obtain what food there was--one waffle maker and a toaster simply aren't enough when 4 or 5 families of four enter the breakfast room within 15 minutes of each other. The second morning of our stay we didn't even bother to try to get the breakfast. There were also some elements of hospitality missing that I would expect from any chain hotel--for instance, the only street map of the town available was a very poor copy of a copy of a copy and the street names were unreadable--to make matters worse, when we asked the desk attendant for directions to a restaurant located at a specific address, she insisted that the restaurant was located on a completely different intersection, and her directions got us lost. I have to give them some credit because I did feel like they were trying to run a decent budget hotel. But my experiences at the Fairfield have been better (and really, my experiences at other LaQuintas have been better) so I would probably try a different hotel next time I visit Champaign Urbana.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: LovePgh
Reviews.Content: This is an older property that has been nicely renovated. My room rate was $54 per night, and this property ranks among the top for value. The front desk staff was kind, caring, and efficient. The bed was very comfortable and I slept well. The amenities were as expected, and breakfast was adequate - basic continental with waffle makers. The location was excellent - right off I-74 and in easy walking distance to many restaurants and a shopping mall. I had only one problem. When I returned to my room on the last evening of my stay, the box of cookies on my dresser was gone, as was my toothpaste and dental floss (good thing I had extras.) I advised the front desk upon check out, and the woman at the desk was very surprised and wrote a note to speak with the maid. I imagine this was an isolated incident. All in all, I highly recommend this La Quinta. It was a very satisfying stay for a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “great locale -- lots of restaurants & shopping”
Reviews.Author: Tracy G
Reviews.Content: Great location for our trip through IL. Great restaurants right next door -- Chevy's is a family favorite and a known entity which is great when traveling and one doesn't want to experiment. Also having the Panera across the other street helps for morning breakfast too. Room was adequate, an older room, but comfy bed. King room had room for husbands bicycle in the room :-). Shower, toilet area was small & very compact but worked altho the light in that room was intermittent. Staff was great at check-in; gave us coupons for Chevy's when we commented that we were headed over there after check-in. Bed was very comfy and over all would certainly recommend a stay. The hotel offered breakfast, but we had our eye on the Panera next door -- another well known place and great for traveling so we did not look at the hotel's offerings. The hotel was quiet and restful after a long days drive.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: pjfam
Reviews.Content: We booked online, and were pleased with the deals offered. It was more affordable than any other hotel we looked at in the area. The room was a bit stuffy and stale when we arrived, but it looked pretty clean. The bed was clean and comfortable, and there was a microwave, refrigerator, hair dryer and coffee maker in room, which was nice. The location is not ideal, as it sits on a busy street corner by the Market Square, so there is a lot of traffic noise. There is a Bob Evans across the street for a convenient (but a bit expensive) breakfast in the morning (of you are weary of those continental breakfasts). Overall, a decent stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it very much!”
Reviews.Author: beegerb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the La Quinta one night while visiting the university. It was great. The beds were very comfortable and the pillows too. It is a spacious room with a separate large sink /mirror area. I had not stayed at this brand for years and ages ago I think it had a subpar reputation, but this motel exceeded my expectations. The breakfast area was large with plenty of seating and space to move. It is right across from the check in desk so the staff was able to keep attentive of it. When I let the lady know the waffle ix was empty she handled it right away. She also cleaned up or tried to get the syrup stickiness off the floor. Not really the motel's fault; people please use some manners! It was the usual hot cold breakfast - waffles, cereal, etc. I enjoy these free breakfasts and think they add a lot of value to a stay. The pool was outside and looked decent, the std. small hotel pool, but useable. I would recommend this hotel, and by the way it is right across from a mall!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: sciencemagic
Reviews.Content: Got one room with double bed for $75 through Priceline. I've stayed in other LaQuintas that were not so nice, but this one was definitely above average. Room was very quiet, could hardly hear a sound. Front desk staff friendly and accommodating. Wireless internet worked great. Breakfast choices were a bit limited, and breakfast closes at 9 am. If you don't get there early, most of the food is gone except for cereal. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: Pagz
Reviews.Content: We were heading to FL for Spring break and needed to beat the snow so we booked a room here at the last minute. Location was good right off of I-57. Breakfast choices were good. The rooms were nothing special and the bedding was right out of a Red Roof or Super 8. I expected a little better quality, but it served it's purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jkaaz101406
Reviews.Content: For a run of the mill, inexpensive hotel near shopping and the university, La Quinta is very doable. My husband and I booked the room for a reasonable price, enjoyed the free breakfast and found the front desk staff very helpful. The only problem I experienced was a lack of air circulation in the room. When there are more than two people in the room using the bathroom throughout the day, it can get a little smelly. Fortunately, I never travel without some room spray and things ended up just fine. I have stayed in better hotels, but this place is clean, comfortable, centrally located and is staffed with friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but PROBLEMS Here”
Reviews.Author: KilgoreT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Quinta in Champain on an overnight road trip. We make the trip several times a year and usually stay at another hotel in the area - but unfortunately they were booked. We later found out there were baseball/softball tournaments, a dog show and several other events taking place in Champaign. Once we arrived, the problems began. The trip took longer than expected and we arrived around 11:15 PM. When I went to check-in, another guest was waiting and there was a sign left by the front desk saying, "we'll be right back." We waited 15 minutes before the desk clerk arrived to check us in. We had arranged for a crib for our toddler, but it wasn't in the room when we arrived. The room was filthy with trash on the on the floor, one unmade bed and furniture pulled away from walls with piles of trash behind it. The desk clerk brought us a high chair, instead of the crib and agreed that the room hadn't been cleaned. The halls and reception area were trashy and dirty as well. He gave us another room - but it only had one double bed (the other was missing) and when I brought him into show him that one of the beds was gone, he said that this "must be the room with the leak" and showed me the ceiling was falling in over the "missing" bed. We finally got a room that was "clean enough" and he promised to bring the crib. We waited another half hour with our exhausted child crying because she didn't have a bed. I finally called the front desk and was told that he couldn't find a crib and he'd tried to reach all the managers to see where they were stored, but they were unavailable. So my wife put the baby in her bed and we attempted to sleep - it was a long, restless night as the noises from the hall and a toddler used to her own bed kept us awake most of the night. The next morning I asked to speak to the manager about the issues. He told me that he already knew about them and was unwilling to discuss. He put the blame on the desk clerk, who was working his second week at the hotel. I asked if it was a smart choice to have this new person working on such a busy weekend. He then told me that he worked until well after midnight and had stayed on-site overnight to help with the crowd. I couldn't believe that he would tell me this with the problems that we encountered starting at 11:15PM. I told him that I hadn't stayed in a La Quinta in about 20 years and I wouldn't be staying in one in the future and inexplicably he said "that's good." I don't know if he was trying to be dismissive or was just very nervous. He was obviously uncomfortable discussing any of the problems with me (and yes, I remained calm and civil) and told me to leave - "things were taken care of." I asked what that meant and he said that "nothing will appear on your card" and waved me away with the back of his hand. No apologies, no comments, nothing - just - shooed me away. In short - the worst hotel experience that I've had in a long, long time.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicer LaQuinta Inns”
Reviews.Author: tammyssong
Reviews.Content: We typically like to stay at more upscale hotels when on vacation but we stayed at this LaQuinta while moving our family from MN to TN. We were pleasantly surprised at this hotel. From the decor to the employees, everything was above average for what you might expect of a typical LaQuinta. We were so pleased that we chose to stay at a LaQuinta 2 other times since then but we have found that "all LaQuinta's are not created equal" and this one in Champaign, IL has been by far the nicest we've stayed at. I wish there were more like this one!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Horrible Horrible”
Reviews.Author: OneGus
Reviews.Content: I would STRONGLY urge people to stay at many of the other hotel options in Champaign. We stayed there 1 night and was one of the worst hotels I've been in. Upon check-in we heard the person in front of us complaining about a gnat problem in their room and was upset. The clerk basically blew him off and just said that it happens when it rains...which it had rained earlier that day. That should have been our sign to just go find another hotel! We checked into our room and it was basically as expected-- nothing special, but gives you a place to sleep. As the night goes on, we keep noticing more big black bugs crawling around. I'd finally had enough when I go to get a pillow out of the bed and the bug is crawling on the pillow and another one on the comforter! I go complain to the front desk and they say they can move us to another room. It is 3am at this time and some people in our room were already sleeping. They decided to stay in the bug room, but 2 of us did not want to sleep in the bed with bugs crawling all over so moved to the new room. As we are walking to the new room, we see more of the same bugs in the hallway, so not sure this next one will be any better! The next day they insist on charging us for BOTH rooms because we split up and 2 girls stayed asleep in the original room. Their customer service was absolutely horrible and all of their explanations on why charging us for both rooms ran in circles. All I know is that I was NOT staying in a room with bugs in the bed and I should not have to pay for the bug-free room I moved to. There are too many other options of hotels to stay at in Champaign, so I will not be returning here or to any La Quinta. Stay at a place where the management and staff will care about providing a decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel at a Great Rate”
Reviews.Author: JaneB2
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel located at a nearby shopping center with lots of chain restaurants around it. The room was fine, the location is fairly quiet, the breakfast was pretty good. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious”
Reviews.Author: vau604
Reviews.Content: It took a while to check in since there was only one person staffing the counter who was on the phone with a customer who seemed to be demanding all the fine print of their pricing. But she was very apologetic and got me checked in just as soon as she could. The room was clean and spacious and seemed pretty new or at least renovated not too too long ago. It was quiet too but that's probably because it was REALLY cold at the time and a little early for people to be doing campus visits at UIUC. The location felt safe and the town's only mall was really close by. The free breakfast is nothing fancy - bagels, toast, cereal, fruit, tea, coffee, juice. Good enough for me. In the rare event that I have to travel there again, I'd stay at La Quinta.

Reviews.Title: “sorry we didn't stay here sooner”
Reviews.Author: oldcpa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the LaQuinta for three nights in April, 2006. We were well pleased with the room. The bed was comfortable, the room and bath were both clean and well-lighted and the staff was friendly both at check-in and check-out. The complimentery breakfast was first rate and the in-room coffee maker helped get us started in the morning. We had one small problem (a slow draining bathtub ) but didn't report it until we checked out. The desk-clerk took a days charge off our bill. This was our mistake, if we had reported it sooner I feel sure it would have been corrected. We've been coming to Champaign for the past three years while our daughter was in grad school, Now that she's graduating we're sorry we didn't discover the LaQuita sooner as it's the best we found in Champaign/Urbana.

Reviews.Title: “Not very friendly to Priceline users”
Reviews.Author: jennifer197878
Reviews.Content: Got this room through Priceline for $35 per night. Upon check in, it was mentioned no less than 4 times that we had booked through Priceline. We requested a king size bed, but our request was refused because we used Priceline. The room was clean and was average sized. The beds are very worn out and extremely uncomfortable. The walls are thin, we were awaken several times during the night by loud and rude people slamming their doors and laughing down the hallway. This finally stopped around 3 am. The free breakfast was nice. Cereal, bagels, toast, muffins, yogurt, fresh fruit and juice were all offered. Overrall, it was defintely worth the $35, but I would not pay the $70 that was offered through the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean and Very Reasonable!”
Reviews.Author: healin1
Reviews.Content: We took our son to the University of Illinois to explore the possiblity of him attending when he graduates. We decided to spend a night at the La Quinta because expedia was offering it for 45.00 on a Sunday night! It also included breakfast. Gosh, at that rate it was almost free! The staff was really friendly and the hotel is clean and it looks like it was probably just remodeled. If our son does end up going to UOI we will definitely choose La Quinta for our future overnight stays!

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn Champaign
HotelInfo.Address: 1900 Center Dr., Champaign, IL 61820
